subject: Career
title: Writing for Decision-Makers
description: A quick win: understand Writing for Decision-Makers.

hook.text: An executive reads 200 documents a week. If your proposal doesn't communicate value in 30 seconds, it's gone.

buildup.text: Decision-makers need: what's the problem, what do you recommend, what does it cost, what happens if we don't.

discovery.text: Amazon's memo culture works because six-page narratives force clear thinking before meetings.

twist.text: Executives don't want options without recommendations. 'Here are three options' is lazy. 'I recommend option B.

climax.text: Format for scanning: bold the key points, use bullet lists, and front-load the recommendation.

punchline.text: Write for the person with the least time and the most decisions.

quiz.question: What do decision-makers want from written communication?
options: Problem, recommendation, cost, and consequences ‚Äî not just options
